title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India, tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, eating places, pictures, experiences etc.

**Food and Recipes Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Food+and+Recipes+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=899972afbc4bab665798a0f5917960a98ec4f4d5
comments: Single people working a private job or couples both working private jobs, how often in a week do you cook food at home?
Single  working guy [24] here except Sundays everyday I cook . Sundays are biryani day and I haven't learnt how to make biryani yet.

That's wonderful. I always associate biryani with communal food or atleast for a large family. Biryanis cooked for 20 odd people always hits different. It's probably for the best that you don't know how to cook biryani ;P
Well well not to brag but I order a family pack biryani for myself alone. So won't be a problem. :P
